<h3 id="X24470">X(24470)&nbsp;=&nbsp;  X(3)X(7)&cap;X(5)X(57)</h3>
Barycentrics &nbsp;&nbsp; 2*a^4+2*(b+c)*a^3-(b^2-4*b*c+c^2)*a^2-2*(b^2-c^2)*(b-c)*a-(b^2-c^2)^2 : :
<b><br>
X(24470) = X(1)+3*X(11246), 3*X(354)+X(1770), 3*X(354)-X(15171), 3*X(553)-X(942), 9*X(553)-X(950), 3*X(553)+X(4292), 6*X(553)-X(12433), 3*X(942)-X(950), X(950)+3*X(4292), 2*X(950)-3*X(12433), X(3868)+3*X(11112), 2*X(4292)+X(12433), 3*X(5049)-X(10624), 3*X(5434)+X(5903), 3*X(5902)+X(7354)
</b>
<p>
See Antreas Hatzipolakis and César Lozada, <a href="http://www.hyacinthos.epizy.com/message.php?msg=28401"> <b>Hyacinthos 28401</b></a>.
</p>
<p>

</p>
<p>
X(24470) = midpoint of X(i) and X(j) for these {i,j}: {65, 18990}, {942, 4292}, {1770, 15171}<br>
X(24470) = reflection of X(i) in X(j) for these (i,j): (5044, 12436), (12433, 942), (15172, 5045)<br>
X(24470) = X(143)-of-intouch-triangle<br>
X(24470) = X(5901)-of-2nd-anti-circumperp-tangential-triangle<br>
X(24470) = X(6101)-of-inverse-in-incircle-triangle<br>
X(24470) = X(10263)-of-incircle-circles-triangle<br>
X(24470) = excentral-to-intouch similarity image of X(5)<br>
X(24470) = {X(i),X(j)}-harmonic conjugate of X(k) for these (i,j,k): (3, 7, 6147), (3, 6147, 5719), (4, 21454, 5708), (46, 10404, 495), (79, 3337, 11), (354, 1770, 15171), (443, 9965, 3927), (553, 4292, 942), (999, 4295, 22791), (1836, 3338, 496), (4654, 15803, 11374), (5435, 5714, 1656), (5557, 15228, 1), (5708, 18541, 4), (11374, 15803, 549)<br>
</p>
